symptoms: MIL on, reduced power under load, noticeable rough idle after cold start.

root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: P0301 code indicates consistent misfire pattern; common failure mode for high-mileage engines

root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Fuel injector clog or electrical fault
root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: Could explain single-cylinder misfire if injector stuck closed or driver circuit failed

root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Compression loss due to valve or ring failure
root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: Would show consistent misfire but typically accompanied by reduced power and smoke

most_likely_cause: Ignition coil failure on cylinder 1, likely due to heat stress and high mileage. P0301 code confirms consistent misfire pattern.

recommended_actions.step: Swap ignition coil from cylinder 1 to another cylinder
recommended_actions.why: If misfire follows the coil, confirms coil failure; cheapest diagnostic step

recommended_actions.step: Check fuel injector resistance and spray pattern
recommended_actions.why: Rules out fuel delivery issue before replacing ignition components
Establishes baseline compression to rule out mechanical failure

recommended_actions.step: Scan for pending codes and freeze-frame data
recommended_actions.why: Captures engine conditions when misfire occurred for better diagnosis

tools_parts: OBD-II scanner with live data capability
Spark plug socket and torque wrench
safety_notes: Disconnect battery negative terminal before working on ignition system
Allow engine to cool before removing ignition components
Wear eye protection when releasing fuel system pressure
Use proper jack stands if raising vehicle; never rely on jack alone
warranty_or_tsb_refs: Ford TSB 08-7-6: Ignition coil failures on 5.4L engines (2004-2008)
Check warranty coverage if under 60,000 miles (powertrain)
Motorcraft DG508 coil is OEM replacement part
disclaimers: This analysis is based on provided symptoms and codes; physical inspection may reveal additional issues
Cost estimates are regional averages; actual prices vary by location and shop labor rates
Always request written estimates before authorizing repairs
Second opinion recommended for repairs exceeding $500

confidence.assessment: Moderate confidence based on code pattern; coil swap test would increase to 95%+ certainty.

confidence_uplift_requirements: Freeze-frame data for P0301 showing engine RPM, load, and coolant temp
Ignition coil swap test results (does misfire follow the coil?)
Fuel trim data for all cylinders to rule out fuel delivery issues
Compression test results for cylinder 1 compared to other cylinders
Exact VIN and mileage for TSB applicability check

customer_readiness_check.short_reason: Insufficient diagnostic data; need freeze-frame and coil swap results
